ModuleIndexReverseLookup.cc

00001 #include <ModuleIndexReverseLookup.hh>
00002 #ifndef __APPLE__ 
00003 #include <values.h>
00004 #else
00005 #include <limits.h>
00006 #include <float.h>
00007 #endif
00008 
00009 namespace CALICE {
00010   void ModuleIndexReverseLookup::createIndexReverseLookup(const MappingAndAlignment &mapping) {
00011     if (mapping._moduleLocationList.empty() || mapping._moduleTypeList.empty()) return;
00012     _moduleIndexArray.clear();
00013     UInt_t module_index=0;
00014 
00015     // it is assumed that a module is unambigiously defined by the layer, the wafer row and column index.
00016     // so first all cells of all modules are scanned and a 3D array is filled with the module index where
00017     // the array compoonents are: layer number, wafer row, wafer column.
00018     // very efficient ;-)
00019     // TODO: better idea? more efficient, less memory consumption?
00020 
00021     for(MappingAndAlignment::ModuleList_t::const_iterator module_iter=mapping._moduleLocationList.begin();
00022         module_iter!=mapping._moduleLocationList.end();
00023         module_iter++, module_index++) {
00024         const ModuleDescription &description=mapping._moduleTypeList[module_iter->second.getModuleType()];
00025         for (UInt_t cell_i=0; cell_i<description.getNCells(); cell_i++) {
00026           CellIndex index(description.getGeometricalCellIndex(cell_i)+module_iter->second.getCellIndexOffset());
00027           UInt_t layer_i=index.getLayerIndex();
00028           UInt_t row_i=index.getWaferRow();
00029           UInt_t column_i=index.getWaferColumn();
00030           if (_moduleIndexArray.size()<=layer_i) _moduleIndexArray.resize(layer_i+1);
00031           if (_moduleIndexArray[layer_i].size()<=row_i) _moduleIndexArray[layer_i].resize(row_i+1);
00032           if (_moduleIndexArray[layer_i][row_i].size()<=column_i) _moduleIndexArray[layer_i][row_i].resize(column_i+1,USHRT_MAX);
00033           _moduleIndexArray[layer_i][row_i][column_i]=module_index;
00034         }
00035     }
00036 
00037     // it is assumed that the cell on top of a module is defined by the row, index the wafer index, the pad row
00038     // and the pad column.
00039     // So a multidimensional array is created which contains the cell index where the array components are:
00040     // wafer row, wafer column, pad_row, pad_column.
00041     // very efficient ;-)
00042     // TODO: better idea? more efficient, less memory consumption?
00043 
00044     _moduleTypeArray.clear();
00045     for(MappingAndAlignment::ModuleTypeList_t::const_iterator type_iter=mapping._moduleTypeList.begin();
00046         type_iter!=mapping._moduleTypeList.end();
00047         type_iter++) {
00048       _moduleTypeArray.push_back(CellIndexArray_t());
00049       for (UInt_t cell_i=0; cell_i<type_iter->getNCells(); cell_i++) {
00050         CellIndex index(type_iter->getGeometricalCellIndex(cell_i));
00051         UInt_t row_i=index.getWaferRow();
00052         UInt_t column_i=index.getWaferColumn();
00053         UInt_t pad_row_i=index.getPadRow();
00054         UInt_t pad_column_i=index.getPadColumn();
00055         if (_moduleTypeArray.back().size()<=row_i) _moduleTypeArray.back().resize(row_i+1);
00056         if (_moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i].size()<=column_i) _moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i].resize(column_i+1);
00057         if (_moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i][column_i].size()<=pad_row_i) _moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i][column_i].resize(pad_row_i+1);
00058         if (_moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i][column_i][pad_row_i].size()<=pad_column_i) _moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i][column_i][pad_row_i].resize(pad_column_i+1,USHRT_MAX);
00059         _moduleTypeArray.back()[row_i][column_i][pad_row_i][pad_column_i]=cell_i;
00060       }
00061     }
00062   }
00063 
00064 }
